lexUnit.name: mourn.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: feel deep sorrow following the death or loss of.

sentence.text: WHEN the Angolan government delegates flew back last week to Luanda from Abidjan , capital of Côte d'Ivoire , few were mourning the abortive six-week peace talks they had left behind .
If she mourned inwardly it did not show outwardly .
There are many young men who will mourn her departure from the ranks of the available , ah ( sigh ) , some of whom had fond memories of her , others , merely hopes .
At eighteen he 'd married a beautiful young girl of seventeen , who died when he was twenty-five , and he mourned her for ten years .
Sophie had been mourning Larosse for two years now , and at her age that was long enough .
The Moors wept at leaving Granada and still mourn its loss in their evening prayers .
One day we were celebrating Elizabeth beating her tumour , the next we were mourning her death . "
We mourn his fall .
By the end of 1956 the Communist Party was mourning its lost membership .
` The uptake in book retailing -- this is in the UK -- of electronic aids is very low , very low , " mourns Richard Charkin .
Mr Powell 's leaving will be mourned by colleagues .
In fact , the separatist movement which developed in Sicily after 1943 proved short-lived , though its disappearance is still mourned by a few as ` the end of the Sicilian nation " .
His death in December 1981 was mourned by hundreds of former pupils and countless friends within the deaf community .
Hardy 's death was mourned as the passing of English literature 's ` most eminent figure " in newspapers all over the world .
New president Ralph Laing is welcomed and the death of administrator Robin Prentice is mourned .
They will not be mourned .
As dawn breaks , she returns to her grave leaving him to mourn alone .
They may still be mourning the loss of the parent who has died or left home .
As publishers mourned declining sales of hardback fiction , they also celebrated rising sales overall ( customers will buy two Aga-saga paperbacks for every one hardback ) .
Many young ladies will mourn Steven 's departure .
I mourn for what has been destroyed .
She had to mourn for her friends who died in the accident .
Do not mourn for me ; I shall have influenced history more than any other German . "
In the first place , we all need to mourn for our own sins and for the negative contribution we bring into the world .
He wept and mourned over it all .
15 days after the killing , thousands mourned today in Liverpool .
It was a dull , grey day as if the sky was mourning with us .
The marriage was said to have been stormy , but she mourned fervently , with lifelong observance of the anniversary of his death .
I never heard him raise his voice to her , and he mourned sincerely when she died .
` If only I 'd got my clothes for the wedding , " she mourned .
` We mourn , weep and express a sense of loss for Stephen , " said Fr Burke who said the congregation should give thanks for Ft Lt McNally 's life .
